Package generation

Class DefaultOrder

java.lang.Object
generation.DefaultOrder
All Implemented Interfaces:
Order
Direct Known Subclasses:
StateGenerating
public class DefaultOrder extends Object implements Order
DefaultOrder provides a basic implementation for an order to interact with a MazeFactory by implementing the Order interface and to cater to a client class of the factory that wants to generate a maze. The expected usage scenario is that a client class uses set methods to specify what maze is wanted: the size of the maze, if it needs to be perfect and thus have no rooms, the builder algorithm, and the seed of the random number generator that shall be used. The MazeFactory uses get methods to obtain this specification information and then provides updates on the level of progress that has been made during the maze generation and finally delivers a reference to the computed maze object. By providing the seed for the random number generation together with all other configuration parameters for an algorithm to compute a maze by the MazeFactory, the expectation is that the each order corresponds to a unique maze in a 1-1 manner. So, given the same order again, the MazeFactory is expected to deliver another but equal maze.
Author:
Peter Kemper

  • Constructor Details

    • DefaultOrder

      public DefaultOrder()
      Constructor that initializes fields to meaningful default values. A newly constructed object is sufficiently configured to make the MazeFactory deliver a fully functional maze.

    • DefaultOrder

      public DefaultOrder​(int skillLevel)
      Constructor with a given size of maze that initializes fields to meaningful default values. A newly constructed object is sufficiently configured to make the MazeFactory deliver a fully functional maze.
      Parameters:
      skillLevel - the selected size of the maze, 0 <= skillLevel <= 15

    • DefaultOrder

      public DefaultOrder​(int skillLevel, Order.Builder builder, boolean perfect, int seed)
      Constructor that initializes fields to the given values. If parameter values are chosen accordingly, a newly constructed object is sufficiently configured to make the MazeFactory deliver a fully functional maze.
      Parameters:
      skillLevel - the selected size of the maze, 0 <= skillLevel <= 15
      builder - the selected builder algorithm
      perfect - the maze shall be perfect or not
      seed - the seed for the random number generator

    • isPerfect

      public boolean isPerfect()
      Description copied from interface: Order
      Describes if the ordered maze should be perfect, i.e. there are no loops and no isolated areas, which also implies that there are no rooms as rooms can imply loops
      Specified by:
      isPerfect in interface Order
      Returns:
      true if the requested maze shall be perfect, false otherwise

    • setPerfect

      public void setPerfect​(boolean perfectMaze)
      Selects if the requested maze should be perfect.
      Parameters:
      perfectMaze - if true the maze should be perfect and have no rooms, otherwise rooms are allowed and circles can be present in the maze.

    • setSeed
